pr_title: fix(provision): load Nucleus recipe from build file to component store and config store

timeline.bodyText:
So we're moving this line in nucleus bootstrap script: echo "{configuration:/jvmOptions}" > "$KERNEL_ROOT/alts/current/launch.params"
to here. Nice!
timeline.author: tilo-chen

replies.bodyText: Yeah. The bootstrap script only gets to run in deployments. Here in provisioning I need to set it up explicitly
replies.author: hui-yang

timeline.author: tilo-chen

replies.bodyText:
The loader script will pass in -Droot https://github.com/aws-greengrass/aws-greengrass-nucleus/blob/main/scripts/loader#L27
The Nucleus root path won't be changed even if customers configure it in jvmOptions via deployments
replies.author: hui-yang

timeline.bodyText: After adding getting the recipe from the build file, will we still keep the properties file as well for version? or should the version now come from the recipe?
timeline.author: shaguptashaikh

replies.bodyText: Ideally properties file can be removed. Let me see if I can get the order of the events correct
replies.author: hui-yang

timeline.bodyText: There's some initialization logic in DeviceConfiguration.initializeNucleusComponentConfig() for initializing version and a few more things for the Nucleus component config, is there a way we can consolidate that with this here?
timeline.author: shaguptashaikh

replies.bodyText: I put it here because the interpolation should happen after all configs are loaded. Let me see if this can be optimized.
replies.author: hui-yang

replies.bodyText:
I did some experiments. initializeNucleusComponentConfig was called in DeviceConfiguration constructor. Since I introduced ComponentStore RecipeLoader etc here in the init, changes in initializeNucleusComponentConfig will cause circular dependency issues.
I still kept the logic here for now
replies.author: hui-yang

timeline.bodyText: Should we remove the default for the jvmOptions config from the Nucleus recipe now that the default it evaluated here?
timeline.author: shaguptashaikh

replies.bodyText: Do you mean this should be removed instead of default to empty string? https://code.amazon.com/packages/GreengrassV2ComponentsReleaseCDK/blobs/47911fb22576071ee8ec09c7bf0eef3ef421ae35/--/lib/components/greengrass-nucleus.ts#L68
replies.author: hui-yang

replies.bodyText: I'm keep it in mind when updating the cdk

timeline.author: MikeDombo

timeline.bodyText: We need to modify the pipeline to write the version number into the recipe now instead of properties?
timeline.author: MikeDombo

replies.bodyText:
Yes. Two options

Update version in recipe
Keep build.properties and here we interpolate the recipe with correct version

I'm currently going with #1 but it can be changed
replies.author: hui-yang

timeline.bodyText: Can you add a skip for directories? We currently get a false error that some directory is not a recipe, which we can safely ignore.
timeline.author: MikeDombo

timeline.bodyText: you can't put this here since in most cases this code will never execute. Put this somewhere that always executes so that we always pass the version in.
timeline.author: MikeDombo

replies.bodyText: Ok. I can move it back to where it was
replies.author: hui-yang

timeline.bodyText: Should this be replaceAndWait() or dflt() ? What happens when Nucleus restarts and already has lifecycle config from the tlog?
timeline.author: shaguptashaikh

replies.bodyText:
It's prevented with this check https://github.com/aws-greengrass/aws-greengrass-nucleus/pull/806/files/77b497ecff63d8fdcc1771c88d586700ab512160#diff-3de627667101ba5b23e01542a659fd03c9a728449b99d59d0c309ccdbe5badc5R276-R281
Topics only has updateFromMap and replaceAndWait, but no dflt

timeline.bodyText: This is being done in initializeNucleusComponentConfig as well, is this duplicate?

replies.bodyText:
initializeNucleusComponentConfig only knows about the fallback version 2.0.0.
You have a good point though. I will move SETENV_CONFIG_NAMESPACE.GGC_VERSION_ENV setting to a common code path after version is initialized.
